feed.title: Our World in Data
feed.subtitle: Research and data to make progress against the world’s largest problems

entry.title: Talent is everywhere, opportunity is not. We are all losing out because of this.
entry.summary: The world needs ideas and innovation to make progress against the many problems we face. Creative and talented people that can contribute to this important work are everywhere, but the opportunity to develop is limited to only a small number of well-off children. As a consequence of this, we all – the entire world population – are missing out on the creativity and innovations that would enrich our world and help us move forward.

entry.title: Where are women most at risk of dying in childbirth?
entry.summary: Pregnancy and childbirth are much safer for women today than in the past. But maternal mortality rates are still high in many countries in the world. A woman is 300 to 400 times more likely to die per pregnancy in poor countries than in rich.

entry.title: How many women die in childbirth?
entry.summary: For most of our history, pregnancy and childbirth were dangerous for both baby and mother. Whilst maternal mortality has decreased significantly in recent decades, more than 300,000 women die from pregnancy every year.

entry.title: The world now produces more seafood from fish farms than wild catch
entry.summary: Growing demand for seafood has placed increasing pressures on wild fish populations. One innovation has helped to alleviate some of the pressure on wild fish catch: aquaculture, the practice of fish and seafood farming. Aquaculture production has now overtaken wild fish catch.
